html: 3.21.18  9:07 am   Take a wild guess... about what percent of the words in the dictionary do you think you know the definition of?

3.21.18  9:01 am   "diminished" gets brought up only when discussing chords and intervals it seems, "flat" is a modifier to a note and nothing more. however, diminishing an interval means making one note flat, that's why it gets so confusing.

when we say Cdim we mean C/Eb/Gb. When we say Cdim7 is the seventh also diminished (C/Eb/Gb/Bbb=A)?

     If yes, what do we call C/Eb/Gb/Bb?

      And what about a major seventh in an otherwise diminished C/Eb/Gb/B?

3.21.18  8:55 am   In christianity, do they believe that jesus is literally the son of god, or is he supposed to be god in human form? Are they 2 separate entities that can communicate with each other and stuff, or does god just talk/act in the form of jesus? I know in the bible, there are prophets who speak with god.. but does jesus speak with god? Or no, because he is god? This always confused me. I know everyone can have their own personal beliefs and interpretations and stuff... but what's the traditional view on this?

3.20.18  9:22 pm   When and how did note name/pitches become standardized (at least in western music)?

      I know it's not totally standard. Sometimes people tune up or down or whatever.. but who decided "let's call this note A, and let's all make sure our A's are the same"? Was there some Important European Music Council that got together and made a declaration, then sent letters out to all the famous composers?
